ratings.comment: Took this class with no discussion. No offense, feels like he doesn't do much since there are no recorded lectures whatsoever. Did well on Wiley Plus hw, Pre/Post assignments, and the In the News, but it didn't matter since most of your grade is based on the exams (which were horrible btw). GET HELP EARLY ON - a tutor &/ office hours!

I took this course virtually, and I'm writing this review for anyone considering taking this class virtually. This could not have been a worse experience. There was no lectures, no quizzes, no nothing. We were graded mainly on three exams, and were given no instruction. It was an awful experience, I don't know anyone who got above a B. DO NOT TAKE.

He's a good guy, I was having last-minute problems with some accommodations and even though the deadline for the issues was past due, he still helped me out. I think when you have hundreds of students at a time but are still willing to go the extra mile to help one, shows what kind of professor he is.

My TA was awesome. Class is not that hard. There is a lot of content, but if you read the book thoroughly and take notes you will be fine. Go to class to reinforce concepts and ask a bunch of questions if necessary. Understand the content and don't memorize. I got 95+% on all the exams. They are fair but will test your true conceptual knowledge.

A lot of people complain about this class; however, if you read the book and put in effort in studying for the exams you'll be farther ahead of the class. You will not get an A unless you read the book most likely. The exams are very fair (a lot of people would disagree) but again if you read the book you'll be fine. It's no easy A, but I enjoyed.
Lol oh man, don't take this guy.

Don't waste your money, he doesn't teach the class its taught by another university student, the university should take his name off the syllabus because it's a lie. Homework is due before the topic is taught and midterms are around 18 pages. If you actually want to learn accounting take the class at another university and transfer it over.

Professor Warfield does not actually teach this class; your TA teaches it, and he/she is the maker or breaker of your success. I only saw Warfield twice in the semester (at the beginning and at the final). The short answer is virtually identical to what you do in lecture (lecture clarifies everything you need to know), but MC is tough (hit/miss).

Never came to lecture once. Might have something to do with the class being taught by TAs, but not sure. Tests are a joke. Short answers could be done by a monkey but the multiple choice couldn't be done by God himself. My TA often struggled to explain why the multiple choice answers were wrong. Overall, class is slice of lasagna.

Very difficult class. You MUST do all online homework and reading to keep up, and there is a quiz every couple of chapters. It is a "flipped classroom" and is taught by TAs. Jacob Stroik, my TA, was very good. The exams are hard; multiple choice is very difficult to study for because there's a lot of trick questions.
Professor Warfield doesn't teach the class--it's taught by TA's and I had a really good one! The class itself is presented really well but tests are super hard... the multiple choice hurts

This class is taught by TAs, not this professor. Must read chapters to keep up, do weekly homework, participate in class, quizzes on every few chapters. 3 Exams with multiple choice and short answer. Cumulative final. Must work hard and put in a lot of time to get an A.
Very difficult class. Warfield does not actually teach, it is usually some TA. Take it outside of Madison if at all possible. Definitely one of my least favorite classes ever.

This class is terrible. Don't take it at Madison. Take it in Summer school. Seriously I was told that as advice and I ignored it. Worst mistake ever. This class was the bane of my existence. There's weekly homework, participation grades, three multiple choice and short answer tests, and a ton of other homework. It's a weed out class. I hate it.

Classes are taught by TA's if you have a good one you will be fine, if you have a bad one good luck. The exams are harder then they need to be and are almost impossible to study for. This class is made to weed people out of business. Good luck.

A lot of people wouldn't post this here because Warfield is the overseeing professor of 100 and doesnt actually teach it. However, he needs to be held ACCountable for this monstrosity. The tests are hell. The essays are idiotic. Getting help at office hours is near impossible. This guy needs to kick his student TAs into shape. TAKE SOMEWHERE ELSE!
Very knowledgable and inspirational. He also gives very helpful and specific critical feedbacks on group projects and presentations.

One of the best professors I've had. Extremely knowledgable. Great lecturer who likes to point out the connections and big pictures. He makes you think and work very hard, but he cares about his students. Not an easy class. You reap what you sow. He's very well-known, but don't let that intimidate you as he gives great profession advice.
If you ever get chance to take class with Prof. Warfield, do it! Lecture is very helpful and exams are challenging but fair.

loved this class! tests and quizzes were almost identical to the homework. go to the review session before the test. homework prepares for the tests great so make sure you do it! wasn't a fan of group work at the beginning but it definitely helped and go to class!!

Very fair professor. Exams and quizzes are just like the homework he assigns. If you put in the effort, you will learn a lot and get a good grade in the process. I appreciate how straight-forward he is. He tells you exactly what you need to learn in order to do well in the class.
One of the most knowledgeable professors in the B-school.  Took him for 301 as well and learned a great deal.  Material is challenging but a B is very attainable.

A class with Professor Warfield will undoubtedly be one of the highlights of your academic career. His knowledge is extraordinary, and his ability to convey the course content to students is spot on. You will have to put in a great deal of work, but the knowledge your gain in his course is amazing. Highly Highly Recommended.
Prof Warfield was a great professor, he's extremely smart and clearly depicts what he expects during class. He also clarifies and gives extra help when needed, great Prof to work with!

Very clear and keeps things interesting. Class goes by very quickly. Warfield knows his accounting and presents it in a manner everyone can understand. Genuinely cares about his students and is always available to lend a hand.
Great professor- knows his stuff. Heavy work load, but worth the effort.
Good professor.  Knows his material and communicates it well.  Make sure you do the homework....it really helps!  Class is not easy, but Warfield is very patient and willing to help his students.
Very overrated!
No Comments
